verses.plain: Concerning the Ammonites, thus saith the LORD; Hath Israel no sons? hath he no heir? why then doth their king inherit Gad, and his people dwell in his cities?

tokens.t: Concerning the Ammonites, thus saith the
; Hath Israel no sons? hath he no heir? why
doth their king inherit Gad, and his people dwell in his cities?

verses.plain: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that I will cause an alarm of war to be heard in Rabbah of the Ammonites; and it shall be a desolate heap, and her daughters shall be burned with fire: then shall Israel be heir unto them that were his heirs, saith the LORD.

tokens.t: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith the

, that I will cause an alarm of war to be heard in Rabbah of the Ammonites; and it shall be a desolate heap, and her daughters shall be burned with fire: then shall Israel be heir unto them that were his heirs, saith the

verses.plain: Howl, O Heshbon, for Ai is spoiled: cry, ye daughters of Rabbah, gird you with sackcloth; lament, and run to and fro by the hedges; for their king shall go into captivity, and his priests and his princes together.

tokens.t: Howl, O Heshbon, for Ai is spoiled: cry, ye daughters of Rabbah, gird you with sackcloth; lament, and run to and fro by the hedges; for their king shall go into captivity,
his priests and his princes together.

verses.plain: Wherefore gloriest thou in the valleys, thy flowing valley, O backsliding daughter? that trusted in her treasures, saying, Who shall come unto me?

tokens.t: Wherefore gloriest thou in the valleys, thy flowing valley, O backsliding daughter? that trusted in her treasures,
, Who shall come unto me?

verses.plain: Behold, I will bring a fear upon thee, saith the Lord GOD of hosts, from all those that be about thee; and ye shall be driven out every man right forth; and none shall gather up him that wandereth.

tokens.t: Behold, I will bring a fear upon thee, saith the Lord
of hosts, from all those that be about thee; and ye shall be driven out every man right forth; and none shall gather up him that wandereth.

verses.plain: And afterward I will bring again the captivity of the children of Ammon, saith the LORD.

tokens.t: And afterward I will bring again the captivity of the children of Ammon, saith the

verses.plain: ¶ Concerning Edom, thus saith the LORD of hosts; Is wisdom no more in Teman? is counsel perished from the prudent? is their wisdom vanished?

tokens.t: ¶ Concerning Edom, thus saith the
of hosts;
wisdom no more in Teman? is counsel perished from the prudent? is their wisdom vanished?

verses.plain: Flee ye, turn back, dwell deep, O inhabitants of Dedan; for I will bring the calamity of Esau upon him, the time that I will visit him.

tokens.t: Flee ye, turn back, dwell deep, O inhabitants of Dedan; for I will bring the calamity of Esau upon him, the time
I will visit him.

verses.plain: If grapegatherers come to thee, would they not leave some gleaning grapes? if thieves by night, they will destroy till they have enough.

tokens.t: If grapegatherers come to thee, would they not leave
gleaning grapes? if thieves by night, they will destroy till they have enough.

verses.plain: But I have made Esau bare, I have uncovered his secret places, and he shall not be able to hide himself: his seed is spoiled, and his brethren, and his neighbours, and he is not.

tokens.t: But I have made Esau bare, I have uncovered his secret places, and he shall not be able to hide himself: his seed is spoiled, and his brethren, and his neighbours, and he
not.

verses.plain: Leave thy fatherless children, I will preserve them alive; and let thy widows trust in me.

tokens.t: Leave thy fatherless children, I will preserve
alive; and let thy widows trust in me.

verses.plain: For thus saith the LORD; Behold, they whose judgment was not to drink of the cup have assuredly drunken; and art thou he that shall altogether go unpunished? thou shalt not go unpunished, but thou shalt surely drink of it.

tokens.t: For thus saith the
; Behold, they whose judgment
not to drink of the cup have assuredly drunken; and
thou he
shall altogether go unpunished? thou shalt not go unpunished, but thou shalt surely drink

verses.plain: For I have sworn by myself, saith the LORD, that Bozrah shall become a desolation, a reproach, a waste, and a curse; and all the cities thereof shall be perpetual wastes.

tokens.t: For I have sworn by myself, saith the
, that Bozrah shall become a desolation, a reproach, a waste, and a curse; and all the cities thereof shall be perpetual wastes.

verses.plain: I have heard a rumour from the LORD, and an ambassador is sent unto the heathen, saying, Gather ye together, and come against her, and rise up to the battle.

tokens.t: I have heard a rumour from the
, and an ambassador is sent unto the heathen,
, Gather ye together, and come against her, and rise up to the battle.

verses.plain: For, lo, I will make thee small among the heathen, and despised among men.

tokens.t: For, lo, I will make thee small among the heathen,
despised among men.

verses.plain: Thy terribleness hath deceived thee, and the pride of thine heart, O thou that dwellest in the clefts of the rock, that holdest the height of the hill: though thou shouldest make thy nest as high as the eagle, I will bring thee down from thence, saith the LORD.

tokens.t: Thy terribleness hath deceived thee,

the pride of thine heart, O thou that dwellest in the clefts of the rock, that holdest the height of the hill: though thou shouldest make thy nest as high as the eagle, I will bring thee down from thence, saith the

verses.plain: Also Edom shall be a desolation: every one that goeth by it shall be astonished, and shall hiss at all the plagues thereof.

tokens.t: Also Edom shall be a desolation: every one that goeth by it shall be astonished, and shall hiss at all the plagues thereof.

verses.plain: As in the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah and the neighbour cities thereof, saith the LORD, no man shall abide there, neither shall a son of man dwell in it.

tokens.t: As in the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah and the neighbour
thereof, saith the
, no man shall abide there, neither shall a son of man dwell in it.

verses.plain: Behold, he shall come up like a lion from the swelling of Jordan against the habitation of the strong: but I will suddenly make him run away from her: and who is a chosen man, that I may appoint over her? for who is like me? and who will appoint me the time? and who is that shepherd that will stand before me?

tokens.t: Behold, he shall come up like a lion from the swelling of Jordan against the habitation of the strong: but I will suddenly make him run away from her: and who
a chosen
I may appoint over her? for who
like me? and who will appoint me the time? and who
that shepherd that will stand before me?

verses.plain: Therefore hear the counsel of the LORD, that he hath taken against Edom; and his purposes, that he hath purposed against the inhabitants of Teman: Surely the least of the flock shall draw them out: surely he shall make their habitations desolate with them.

tokens.t: Therefore hear the counsel of the

, that he hath taken against Edom; and his purposes, that he hath purposed against the inhabitants of Teman: Surely the least of the flock shall draw them out: surely he shall make their habitations desolate with them.

verses.plain: The earth is moved at the noise of their fall, at the cry the noise thereof was heard in the Red sea.

tokens.t: The earth is moved at the noise of their fall, at the cry the noise thereof was heard in the Red sea.

verses.plain: Behold, he shall come up and fly as the eagle, and spread his wings over Bozrah: and at that day shall the heart of the mighty men of Edom be as the heart of a woman in her pangs.

tokens.t: Behold, he shall come up and fly as the eagle, and spread his wings over Bozrah: and at that day shall the heart of the mighty men of Edom be as the heart of a woman in her pangs.

verses.plain: ¶ Concerning Damascus. Hamath is confounded, and Arpad: for they have heard evil tidings: they are fainthearted; there is sorrow on the sea; it cannot be quiet.

tokens.t: ¶ Concerning Damascus. Hamath is confounded, and Arpad: for they have heard evil tidings: they are fainthearted;
sorrow on the sea; it cannot be quiet.

verses.plain: Damascus is waxed feeble, and turneth herself to flee, and fear hath seized on her: anguish and sorrows have taken her, as a woman in travail.

tokens.t: Damascus is waxed feeble,
turneth herself to flee, and fear hath seized on
anguish and sorrows have taken her, as a woman in travail.

verses.plain: How is the city of praise not left, the city of my joy!

tokens.t: How is the city of praise not left, the city of my joy!

verses.plain: Therefore her young men shall fall in her streets, and all the men of war shall be cut off in that day, saith the LORD of hosts.

tokens.t: Therefore her young men shall fall in her streets, and all the men of war shall be cut off in that day, saith the
of hosts.

verses.plain: And I will kindle a fire in the wall of Damascus, and it shall consume the palaces of Ben-hadad.

tokens.t: And I will kindle a fire in the wall of Damascus, and it shall consume the palaces of Ben-hadad.

verses.plain: ¶ Concerning Kedar, and concerning the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon shall smite, thus saith the LORD; Arise ye, go up to Kedar, and spoil the men of the east.

tokens.t: ¶ Concerning Kedar, and concerning the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon shall smite, thus saith the
; Arise ye, go up to Kedar, and spoil the men of the east.

verses.plain: Their tents and their flocks shall they take away: they shall take to themselves their curtains, and all their vessels, and their camels; and they shall cry unto them, Fear is on every side.

tokens.t: Their tents and their flocks shall they take away: they shall take to themselves their curtains, and all their vessels, and their camels; and they shall cry unto them, Fear
on every side.

verses.plain: ¶ Flee, get you far off, dwell deep, O ye inhabitants of Hazor, saith the LORD; for Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon hath taken counsel against you, and hath conceived a purpose against you.

tokens.t: ¶ Flee, get you far off, dwell deep, O ye inhabitants of Hazor, saith the
; for Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon hath taken counsel against you, and hath conceived a purpose against you.

verses.plain: Arise, get you up unto the wealthy nation, that dwelleth without care, saith the LORD, which have neither gates nor bars, which dwell alone.

tokens.t: Arise, get you up unto the wealthy nation, that dwelleth without care, saith the
, which have neither gates nor bars,
dwell alone.

verses.plain: And their camels shall be a booty, and the multitude of their cattle a spoil: and I will scatter into all winds them that are in the utmost corners; and I will bring their calamity from all sides thereof, saith the LORD.

tokens.t: And their camels shall be a booty, and the multitude of their cattle a spoil: and I will scatter into all winds them
in the utmost corners; and I will bring their calamity from all sides thereof, saith the

verses.plain: And Hazor shall be a dwelling for dragons, and a desolation for ever: there shall no man abide there, nor any son of man dwell in it.

tokens.t: And Hazor shall be a dwelling for dragons,
a desolation for ever: there shall no man abide there, nor
son of man dwell in it.

verses.plain: ¶ The word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah the prophet against Elam in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, saying,

tokens.t: ¶ The word of the
that came to Jeremiah the prophet against Elam in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, saying,

verses.plain: Thus saith the LORD of hosts; Behold, I will break the bow of Elam, the chief of their might.

tokens.t: Thus saith the
of hosts; Behold, I will break the bow of Elam, the chief of their might.

verses.plain: And upon Elam will I bring the four winds from the four quarters of heaven, and will scatter them toward all those winds; and there shall be no nation whither the outcasts of Elam shall not come.

tokens.t: And upon Elam will I bring the four winds from the four quarters of heaven, and will scatter them toward all those winds; and there shall be no nation whither the outcasts of Elam shall not come.

verses.plain: For I will cause Elam to be dismayed before their enemies, and before them that seek their life: and I will bring evil upon them, even my fierce anger, saith the LORD; and I will send the sword after them, till I have consumed them:

tokens.t: For I will cause Elam to be dismayed before their enemies, and before them that seek their life: and I will bring evil upon them,
my fierce anger, saith the
; and I will send the sword after them, till I have consumed them:

verses.plain: And I will set my throne in Elam, and will destroy from thence the king and the princes, saith the LORD.

tokens.t: And I will set my throne in Elam, and will destroy from thence the king and the princes, saith the

verses.plain: ¶ But it shall come to pass in the latter days, that I will bring again the captivity of Elam, saith the LORD.

tokens.t: ¶ But it shall come to pass in the latter days,
I will bring again the captivity of Elam, saith the

footnotes.text: thy…: or, thy valley floweth away
turn…: or, they are turned back
appoint me…: or, convent me in judgment?
on…: or, as on the sea
wealthy: or, that is at ease
in…: Heb. cut off into corners, or, that have the corners of their hair polled
